project.name: Port Sulphur Terminal Analysis
project.description: Former Freeport Sulphur Company maritime terminal facility on the Mississippi River

historical.name: Historical Photographs
historical.description: Library of Congress archival photographs from the Office of War Information collection, circa 1940s

aerial.name: Aerial & Satellite Views
aerial.description: Modern aerial and satellite imagery showing property boundaries and geographic context

regulatory.name: Regulatory Documents
regulatory.description: EPA ECHO facility reports and environmental compliance data

images.title: Sulphur Conveyor Belt and Dock Infrastructure
images.description: Black and white photograph showing conveyor belt systems and sulphur loading dock facilities at the Port Sulphur terminal. Visible infrastructure includes conveyor mechanisms, storage areas, and dock buildings. Catalogue reference: OWI 33875 D.
images.source: Library of Congress - Office of War Information Collection

location.facility: Freeport Sulphur Company Port Sulphur Terminal

images.historical_context: Freeport Sulphur Company operated this facility from 1933-2005 as a logistics, refining, storage and shipping hub for sulphur operations. During WWII, sulphur was a critical strategic material for munitions production.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: Sulphur Barge Loading Operations
images.description: Aerial view of a barge loaded with sulphur at the Port Sulphur dock facility. The image shows conveyor systems, waterway access, and adjacent storage areas. Catalogue reference: OWI 478832 IMO.
images.source: Library of Congress - Office of War Information Collection

location.facility: Freeport Sulphur Company Port Sulphur Terminal

images.historical_context: This image captures the barge loading operations that were central to the facility's mission of shipping processed sulphur via the Mississippi River to Gulf of Mexico ports.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: Dock Pipework and Industrial Infrastructure
images.description: View down the dock showing extensive pipework and industrial infrastructure including sulphur processing equipment, water tower, and facility buildings. Catalogue reference: OWI 33875 D.
images.source: Library of Congress - Office of War Information Collection

location.facility: Freeport Sulphur Company Port Sulphur Terminal

images.historical_context: The extensive pipework system transported hot molten sulphur from storage tanks to loading facilities. The Frasch Process required maintaining sulphur at high temperatures during transport and loading.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: Waterfront Facilities and Towboats
images.description: View of waterfront showing towboats including the 'Homer A. Burnell' moored at the dock, with processing buildings and employee housing visible in the background. Catalogue reference: OWI 33880 D.
images.source: Library of Congress - Office of War Information Collection

location.facility: Freeport Sulphur Company Port Sulphur Terminal

images.historical_context: Port Sulphur functioned as a company town with Freeport Sulphur providing housing and infrastructure for workers. The towboat fleet was essential for managing barge traffic on the Mississippi River.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: Port Sulphur Company Town Overview
images.description: Wide-angle view of the Port Sulphur company town showing employee housing, water tower, and surrounding landscape. Catalogue reference: OWI 33881 D.
images.source: Library of Congress - Office of War Information Collection
images.historical_context: Freeport Sulphur developed Port Sulphur as a planned community to support its industrial operations, providing housing and amenities for workers and their families from 1933 until operations ceased.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: Gantry Crane and Barge Loading Operations
images.description: Detailed view of a gantry crane in operation loading sulphur onto a barge. Shows conveyor systems, loading mechanisms, and dry sulphur storage. Catalogue reference: OWI 33912 D.
images.source: Library of Congress - Office of War Information Collection

location.facility: Freeport Sulphur Company Port Sulphur Terminal

images.historical_context: The facility employed 'vatting' operations creating acres of dry sulphur storage blocks, visible in this image. Gantry cranes and conveyors moved material from storage to barges for shipment.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: Property Boundary GIS View
images.description: GIS public viewer screenshot showing property boundaries, parcel information, and aerial imagery of the Port Sulphur terminal site along the Mississippi River.
images.source: GIS Public Viewer / Property Records System

location.facility: Former Freeport McMoRan Port Sulphur Facility

images.historical_context: Current property status following cessation of operations in early 2000s and Hurricane Katrina damage in 2005. Site is being evaluated for redevelopment as a maritime terminal.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: Property Boundary GIS View - Alternate Angle
images.description: Additional GIS public viewer screenshot showing detailed property boundary delineation and parcel data for the Port Sulphur terminal site.
images.source: GIS Public Viewer / Property Records System

location.facility: Former Freeport McMoRan Port Sulphur Facility

images.historical_context: Property records and GIS data used for due diligence analysis of the former industrial site.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: Property Assessment GIS Data
images.description: GIS viewer screenshot displaying property assessment data and boundary information for due diligence analysis.
images.source: GIS Public Viewer / Property Records System

location.facility: Former Freeport McMoRan Port Sulphur Facility

images.author: William S. Davis III

images.description: Detailed GIS view of parcel boundaries and property configuration along the Mississippi River waterfront.
images.source: GIS Public Viewer / Property Records System

location.facility: Former Freeport McMoRan Port Sulphur Facility

images.author: William S. Davis III

location.facility: Former Freeport McMoRan Port Sulphur Facility

images.title: Regional Context Aerial View
images.description: Wide-area aerial/satellite view showing regional context of the Port Sulphur site in relation to surrounding properties and Mississippi River configuration.
images.historical_context: Regional view showing the site's strategic location on the Mississippi River between New Orleans and the Gulf of Mexico.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: Site Context Aerial Imagery
images.description: Aerial view providing context for the Port Sulphur terminal site location and surrounding area.
images.historical_context: Current aerial view showing post-Katrina site conditions and surrounding development.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: Detailed Site Aerial View
images.description: Detailed aerial photograph showing the Port Sulphur terminal site configuration and immediate surroundings.
images.historical_context: Detailed view of current site conditions for development planning and engineering assessment.
images.author: William S. Davis III

images.title: EPA ECHO Facility Report
images.description: EPA ECHO (Enforcement and Compliance History Online) Detailed Facility Report for Freeport McMoRan Energy LLC - Port Sulphur Facility, showing compliance status, enforcement history, and regulatory information. Address: 28310 HWY 23, Port Sulphur, LA 70083. FRS ID: 110022408321. Latitude: 29.473414, Longitude: -89.686632.

location.facility: Freeport McMoRan Energy LLC - Port Sulphur Facility

images.historical_context: EPA regulatory compliance history for the former Freeport McMoRan facility, showing environmental monitoring and enforcement activities through 2003 when operations were winding down.
images.author: William S. Davis III

facility_info.name: Former Freeport Sulphur / Freeport McMoRan Port Sulphur Terminal
facility_info.location: Mississippi River Mile 39, Port Sulphur, Plaquemines Parish, Louisiana

data_quality.coordinates_accuracy: High for modern images (EPA/GIS), approximate for historical images (facility-level)
data_quality.date_accuracy: Exact for modern images, approximate decade for historical images
data_quality.metadata_completeness: Good - includes source attribution, locations, subjects, and historical context
